column5: I have been running my sirrius at 88.1 fm. What do I do if I lose that signal? Is there an easier way than turning to all of the stations? I leave Friday for Lac Seul.
Not quite sure of your question, but you will have 88.1 everywhere except international falls.
What do you turn it too then.My question was that, if I lose 88.1. I did that in Cedar Falls, Ia. and couldn't find another station. Thanks
How to find a channel. Thanks
used my sirius radio at chamberlain narrows on lac suel , tuned to channel 88.1 and it worked great.
Anyone use XM or Sirius Satellite radio in Canada? Will it work at about 50 Degrees north Latitude, 90 degrees west Longitude?
I have used both. My cottage is on eagle and it works clear as a bell. I have been as far north as lac seul and have had no problems.
Just got back from northern Quebec, and had my new Serius radio with me. Worked great.
I have Sirius, it works perfectly up to Red Lake and Sioux Lookout.:-)
Used my Sirius with no problems at Pine Portage Lodge on Kabinakagami lake.
We used ours in Ear Falls with no problem.
I took my Sirius boombox on a fly-in north of Savant lake. Reception was fine but I got only about 4 hours from 8 D batteries.

I had XM for 3 months as a free trial on my new truck when I bought it back in 2003. It worked fine as far up as Kenora. Never tried it further up than that. I canceled the subscription 2 months into the 3 month free trial because I didn't like it (music and listening choice is a very personal thing and I prefer to listen to CD's). But the reception was fine.
My XM2Go Delphi worked great 50 miles north of Kenora. It has a built in antenna, and is about the size of an iPod and I had no problems. Chuck
better get one soon, the trip is less than 3 weeks away!
